result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy S Mccabe Jr in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Timothy S Mccabe Jr.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 1;48 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearances on both files - 22CM563 & 22CM564. Record by Atty. Hagerman who has gone over the charges and penalties, reserves all rights and enters not guilty pleas as to both files. Court sets over for status before assigned judge - Johnson.
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing. Bond set 10-03-2022
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS ALL FILES 22GF1021 & 22GF1049
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH T.M. dob 3-26-1999 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-4589 (22GF1021)
22-4753 & 22-4758 (22GF1049)

Defendant Timothy McCabe present in court, in custody via video with attorney Grace Hagerman for bond purposes only. ADA J.J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prior bond to be forfeited when complaint is filed. Minutes filed.

Defendant Timothy S McCabe in court. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State is requesting two weeks for complaint. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*see new bond set 10/13/2022*

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
